page.title: 09M/V CORILDA II LK 469
page.content: The{Corilda}II is a shellfish boat about 30 feet long,painted black,speed 6-8 knots.She is owned by her crew of two Colin and George Eunson.Equipment includes radar,meter,compass,boat's wireless,C B radio and Decca navigation set. The Corilda II sets creels for crabs through the summer sailing North from Whalsay to the Point of Fethaland,the most northerly point of the mainland of Shetland where 300 or so creels are set.These creels may be set early on Sunday and lifted on Tuesday.The catch of between 20 to 30 boxes are landed at Ulsta on Yell.A factory on Yell processes and cans the catch.As the creels are lifted they are re-baited. They will be lifted again on Thursday. In winter the boat dredges for scallops.This catch is landed at Laxo and is collected by the processors.
